revised_title: Growth Hormone's Impact on Predation Exposure in Rainbow Trout
tldr: The study investigates the effect of growth hormone on the behavioral response of rainbow trout to simulated attacks from a model heron. Growth hormone-treated trout foraged closer to the water surface, resumed feeding earlier, and ate more food than control trout, increasing their susceptibility to aerial predation. This suggests that growth hormone transgenic fish may pose a threat to wild fish populations.
